p: Numerous in vitro studies have reported the antiproliferative activity of saponins on breast cancer, cervical colon, and hepatic carcinomas. It was reported that several signaling pathways have been identified to be responsible for cell death [ 49, 50]. The antiproliferative effect of saponins resulted in the activation of different signaling pathways [ 49], whereas the induction of apoptosis is the most involved pathway [ 51]. Saponins have an important effect on some experimental tumors, such as estrogen receptor-negative mammary carcinogenesis [ 52].
